content.prompt:
​

  • All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The first vertical dashed line passes through (negative 3 pi over 8 comma 0).
    • The second vertical dashed line passes through (negative pi over 8 comma 0).
    • The third vertical dashed line passes through (pi over 8 comma 0).
    • The fourth vertical dashed line passes through (3 pi over 8 comma 0).
    • The first curve displayed between the first and second vertical dashed lines begins in quadrant 3 to the right of the first vertical dashed line, trends up gradually to the right through the point (negative pi over 4 comma 10) and ends to the left of the second vertical dashed line in quadrant 2.
    • The second curve displayed between the second and third vertical dashed lines begins in quadrant 3 to the right of the second vertical dashed line, trends up gradually to the right through the point (0 comma 10) and ends to the left of the third vertical dashed line in quadrant 1.
    • The third curve displayed between the third and fourth vertical dashed lines begins in quadrant 4 to the right of the third vertical dashed line, trends up gradually to the right through the point (pi over 4 comma 10) and ends to the left of the fourth vertical dashed line in quadrant 1.

​The graph of the function g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is given in the xy{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-plane. If g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is the result of multiplicative and additive transformations of the graph of  y=tanx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, what is the period of g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
